item.title: PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes
  • How to Redeem Locker Codes in PGA Tour 2K25
  • How to Get More PGA Tour 2K25 Codes

Like a lot of other 2K Sports games, PGA Tour 2K25 features redeemable codes. Players can use these Locker Codes to get their hands on all sorts of fantastic in-game goodies, including VC, Level Up Tokens, and unique clothing and accessories for their MyPLAYER golfer.

New PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes are released regularly and tend to expire relatively quickly, so players will need to remain on their toes if they want to avoid missing out. The following guide will list all of the active codes for PGA Tour 2K25 and also explain how to redeem them.

Updated August 2, 2025, by Tom Bowen: It's been a while now since the last PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes were released, and many of the previous ones have now expired. Thankfully, there are still a few active codes for new players to redeem, although we're not sure when exactly they're going to expire, so they'll need to act fast to avoid missing out. After doing so, they should take a minute to bookmark this page so that they can check back here every now and again, as despite the lack of activity, we'll continue to search for new locker codes for PGA Tour 2K25 regularly and will update the table below with any that we find.

All PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes

Working PGA Tour 2K25 Codes

Code

Reward

Expiry Date

THEBAYGC

The Bay Golf Club Short-Sleeve T-Shirts

Unknown

NEWYORKGC

New York Golf Club Short-Sleeve T-Shirts

Unknown

Los Angeles Golf Club Short-Sleeve T-Shirts

Unknown

Unknown

BOSTONCOMMON

Unknown

ATLANTADRIVE

Atlanta Drive GC Short-Sleeve T-Shirts

Unknown

PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes are case-sensitive, so players should be sure to use all caps when typing them in.

Expired PGA Tour 2K25 Codes

  • Y72PHRH9MC3W
  • F2ZJG657HYJ6
  • 3B6D56Z76PDK
  • 7BPG2KP3Y3CM
  • PLAYERS
  • FUELUP
  • BACKNINEBOOST
  • TOPGOLF
  • FITZ
  • LAUNCHDAY
  • SWEATSET
  • HELLOGOLFERS
  • LVLUP
  • TEEOFF
  • FULLSWING
  • HELLOGOLFERS
  • HOLEINONE
  • ONTHEGREEN
  • FAIRWAYFINDER

Some PGA Tour 2K25 codes seem to work for some players but not others, so it may be worth trying out a few of the expired Locker Codes just in case.

How to Redeem Locker Codes in PGA Tour 2K25

The process for redeeming PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes is fairly straightforward once players know where to look. The option to do so can be found in the Settings section of the Profile Menu, which can be reached by following the step-by-step instructions below.

  1. Press Start on the main menu to access the Profile Menu .
  2. Use the shoulder buttons to cycle to SETTINGS .
  3. Scroll down and select the REDEEM LOCKER CODE option.
  4. Type or paste one of the working PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes from the list above into the input box and then press the Redeem button.

How to Get More PGA Tour 2K25 Codes

PGA Tour 2K25 Locker Codes will sometimes appear in the news section of the main menu, so players should always be sure to scroll through it when they first boot up the game. New codes are sometimes posted on the game's official Twitter account as well, so those who aren't already following it should do so when they get a chance. Alternatively, they can just check back here from time to time, as we're constantly on the lookout for new codes for PGA Tour 2K25 and will update the list above whenever we find any.

item.title: Roblox: Blade Ball Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Blade Ball Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Blade Ball
  • How to Get More Blade Ball Codes
  • How to Play Blade Ball
  • The Best Roblox Mini-Games Like Blade Ball
  • About the Blade Ball Developers

Summary

  • Roblox players can redeem Blade Ball codes to receive free wheel spins and other great in-game rewards.
  • New Blade Ball codes are typically added on Saturdays when the developers update the game.
  • The Blade Ball codes contained in this guide are checked regularly to ensure that they remain up-to-date.

Blade Ball is a popular Roblox title with several innovative game modes. Its rules are simple. When players enter the playing field, the ball spawns and immediately begins to follow one of them around. In order to survive, this person has to hit the ball, making it fly even faster in the direction in which it was hit.

If players don't block the ball, they die, and the ball will appear again and target somebody else. The winner is the last person standing. As is the case in similar Roblox games, players are provided with several different options for diversifying gameplay. However, these generally need to be bought using coins, which are most easily obtained by redeeming Blade Ball codes.

Updated August 2, 2025, by Tom Bowen: It seems as though new Blade Ball codes may be a thing of the past, with the last one coming many months ago now. Despite this, however, we still check for them every week, and will update the table below if and when we ever find one. With that in mind, you should take a few moments to bookmark this page so that you can check back here every now and again to avoid missing out on future codes for Blade Ball.

  • SERPENT_HYPE - Enter this code to claim a special sword skin
  • VISITS_TY - Enter this code to claim a free spin
  • HAPPYHALLOWEEN - Enter this code to claim a free wheel spin
  • 1BVISITSTHANKS - Enter this code to claim a special sword skin
  • 3MLIKES - Enter this code to claim a free wheel spin
  • HALLOWEEN - Enter this code to claim a special sword skin
  • WEEK4 - Enter this code to claim a special skin
  • RRRANKEDDD - Enter this code to claim 200 coins
  • SORRY4DELAY - Enter this code to claim 160 coins
  • UPDATETHREE - Enter this code to claim a free wheel spin.

  • 5000LIKES - Enter this code to claim some Coins.
  • ThxForSupport - Enter this code to claim some Coins.

  • 50000LIKES - Enter this code to claim some Coins.

  • 10KFOLLOWERZ - Enter this code to claim a special skin.
  • 500K - Enter this code to claim 50 Coins.

How to Redeem Codes in Blade Ball

The process of redeeming codes in Blade Ball is straightforward and similar to the ones found in other Roblox games. However, if players still find themselves facing problems or don't know how to do it, the following step-by-step instructions should help them to achieve their goal:

  • Launch Blade Ball .
  • Click the button labeled Extra in the top right corner of the screen.
  • Scroll down and press the Codes button.
  • Type or paste one of the working Blade Ball codes listed above into the field provided and then click the green checkmark.

How to Get More Blade Ball Codes

If players have redeemed all the codes and want more rewards, there are a few tips. In general, fans can visit the official Discord server of the developers. In addition to the working codes, users will find a lot of interesting content related to the game there, and will also be able to communicate with like-minded people. That said, it's much easier to just bookmark this article, as it is updated every month with all of the relevant codes for Blade Ball .

How to Play Blade Ball

Playing Blade Ball is easy and fun. To do this, simply wait for a new match and when all the players are on the field, the ball will be spawned. It will immediately start moving towards one of the gamers, which will begin glowing red. Then it is necessary to block the ball in time before it collides with the fan. If the collision occurs, the gamer loses. The player who remains alive wins.

The Best Roblox Mini-Games Like Blade Ball

If players are looking for a similar experience, but don't know what to play, it's no longer a problem. The list below will provide players with the 5 best games like Blade Ball . None of them will leave the fans bored and will provide an awesome gaming experience:

  • Epic Minigames
  • Ripull Minigames
  • Red Light Green Light
  • Squid Minigames [29 Games]
  • Sonic Minigames

About the Blade Ball Developers

The Wiggity development team created Blade Ball on 17 June 2023. Their Roblox group has around 20 million members, which is quite a lot.

item.title: Roblox: Death Ball Codes (August 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Death Ball Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Death Ball
  • Where to Find More Death Ball Codes

It's often said that imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, in which case, the developers of Death Ball must really like Blade Ball . The two games are incredibly similar, although many Roblox players now seem to prefer the former, finding its gameplay to be a lot more exciting than what's on offer in the original.

As is the case with Blade Ball , there were once plenty of Death Ball codes that players could redeem for free Gems and other great rewards. Roblox players should be sure to redeem these codes as soon as possible, though, as the game is updated often, which can lead to codes expiring at a moment's notice.

Updated August 2, 2025, by Tom Bowen: The most recent Death Ball code is CLIMBNOW , which you can redeem to get 500 Crystals. After doing so, you should take a moment or two to bookmark this page so that you can check back here regularly, as we're always on the lookout for new codes for Death Ball and will update the list below with any that we find.

All Death Ball Codes

How to Redeem Codes for Death Ball

The process for redeeming Death Ball codes is relatively straightforward and not too dissimilar from redeeming codes in other Roblox games. However, those having trouble can refer to the step-by-step instructions below to help speed up the process.

  1. Launch Death Ball .
  2. Press the "More" button at the top of the screen.
  3. Select "Codes" from the drop-down menu.
  4. Type or paste the code into the box provided and then press "Verify". Alternatively, players can just hit enter.

Where to Find More Death Ball Codes

Players can find new codes for Death Ball in a few different places. For starters, it's a good idea to join the game's official Discord server, both for new codes and information about the game. Players should also follow Sub on Twitter, as they sometimes tweet about the game. However, the best place to find new Death Ball codes is arguably right here, as this guide will be updated regularly as and when new codes become available. As such, it's a good idea to bookmark this page and check back here often so as to avoid missing out on future freebies.

item.title: Nintendo Reminds Fans About 10 Big Upcoming Games for Switch Consoles
item.description:
Nintendo 's latest financial report shines a light on the company's biggest upcoming games for the Switch and Switch 2. The original Nintendo Switch has proven to be a massive success and is well on track to become Nintendo's best-selling piece of hardware of all time. There's even a chance it will become the best-selling video game console period, though it remains to be seen if it can knock the PS2 off its throne.

Time will tell if the Switch 2 is able to match the success of its predecessor, but it's off to an incredible start. Reports indicate that the Switch 2 has passed 6 million units sold, smashing records and becoming the fastest-selling video game console of all time in the process. If Nintendo wants to keep people buying Switch consoles at the rate that they have been, it will need to release high-quality software to entice them. And to that end, Nintendo has recently highlighted 10 of its biggest upcoming games.

Nintendo's latest financial report points out 10 games that are on the way for the Switch family of consoles. Five of the games are Switch 2 exclusives, but the rest can be played on both platforms. First up is Drag x Drive on August 14, to be followed by Kirby and the Forgotten Land: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World on August 28. Then Pokemon Legends: Z-A launches on October 16, with a native release on both the Switch 1 and Switch 2. Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment is on deck for a vague Winter 2025 release. Kirby Air Riders and Metroid Prime 4: Beyond don't have solid release dates yet, but both are due out before the year is over.

Upcoming Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 Games List

  • Drag x Drive - August 14 (Switch 2 Exclusive)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land: Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Star-Crossed World - August 28 (Switch 2 Exclusive)
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A - October 16
  • Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment - Winter 2025 (Switch 2 Exclusive)
  • Kirby Air Riders - TBA 2025 (Switch 2 Exclusive)
  • Metroid Prime 4: Beyond - TBA 2025
  • Rhythm Heaven Groove - 2026
  • Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream - 2026
  • Pokemon Champions - 2026
  • Splatoon Raiders - TBA (Switch 2 Exclusive)

Looking at 2026, Nintendo plans on releasing Rhythm Heaven Groove , Tomodachi Life: Living the Dream , and Pokemon Champions , all for the original Switch. Of course, since the Switch 2 is backward compatible, owners of the new console will be able to play those games as well. Finally, Splatoon Raiders is coming to the Switch 2, though it's currently without a release window. It's possible the game will launch this year, in 2026, or even beyond, but fans will just have to wait for more information on that front.

With some of its biggest games still missing specific release dates, one has to imagine that Nintendo will be hosting a Nintendo Direct at some point in the near-future with a focus on first-party games. Nintendo hosted a Direct in September for eight years straight before breaking its streak in 2024, and so it's possible it will do so this year to fill out the rest of its 2025 calendar. For now, Nintendo fans can mark their calendars accordingly for the games that do have release dates.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Reimagines a Classic Fromsoftware Gimmick for Everdark Sovereign Augur
item.description:
Elden Ring Nightreign has brought out its second wave of Everdark Sovereigns, with the first being a re-imagined Augur expedition, and it comes with a classic FromSoftware twist. While Maris, Fathom of Night, has not really been one of the community’s favorite Nightreign Nightlord bosses, it is one of the most serene, and the Everdark version of the fight amplifies that feeling of cosmic otherworldliness.

Upon being defeated rather easily, the sky overhead darkens, the stars emerge, and the real fight begins. Maris is larger than ever, like a dark star plucked from the sky, and is even more reminiscent of the Elden Beast than before. But players will have quickly noticed that this time, they have a lot of health, far too much in fact, and something doesn’t quite feel right. Then, a teammate starts firing off enormous waves of magic, projectiles that seem far more powerful than any single spell in Elden Ring Nightreign , and that’s when Augur’s gimmick is put on full display, and some fans of past games will recognize exactly what is going on.

The new Everdark cycle was released for Elden Ring Nightreign on July 31.

FromSoftware’s Storm Ruler Gimmick Is Back in Elden Ring Nightreign’s Augur Fight, and It’s a Sight to Behold

More than likely, a number of players will have beaten Maris’ first phase and noticed something strange - there was a weapon drop, but it held only one item, a golden version of their Nightfarers' starting weapon. Considering it doesn’t look particularly special, they may have ignored it until teammates started firing off those aforementioned blue streaks, and everything fell into place. But once acquired, the fight becomes this beautiful dance of a dark cosmic entity versus glistening arcs of blue, and much like Caligo’s boss fight, it becomes quite cinematic.

The Everdark Sovereign Augur fight is Nightreign ’s answer to the Storm Ruler gimmick, a classic weapon of FromSoftware tradition that first appeared in Demon’s Souls . In that game, players challenging the Storm King boss needed the weapon just to be able to hit the enormous flying enemy, and it was an idea that has stuck with FromSoftware ever since. In Dark Souls 3 , players facing Yhorm the Giant would race for the Storm Ruler, charging it up to unleash waves of wind upon Yhorm. Though it didn’t appear in Sekiro , the Divine Dragon relied on a similar gimmick, as it was taken down purely through lightning deflects. Even Elden Ring had a version of the fight, as Rykard’s famously large health bar can only be safely challenged by the conveniently located Serpent Hunter spear.

Everdark Sovereign Augur Is a Good Way of Elevating a Bad Fight With a Good Gimmick

Augur is often considered the weakest boss in Nightreign , and when it isn’t weak, it’s frustrating, as many melee characters can struggle to get to grips with it flying all around the arena. But the Everdark Sovereign version of the fight finds a way to elevate it into something that isn’t necessarily more challenging, but is definitely much more satisfying.

There’s a serenity to the fight rarely found in Nightreign , and while gimmick bosses don’t usually rank well for FromSoftware’s best boss fights, this is one of the rare occasions where the experience is made better by one. Augur is the fourth boss in the game to receive the Everdark Sovereign treatment, and over the next few weeks, three more will be given the same treatment, although it’s unlikely that there will be any more gimmicks again.

"ELDEN RING NIGHTREIGN is a standalone adventure within the ELDEN RING universe, crafted to offer players a new gaming experience by reimagining the game’s core design.

Join forces with other players to take on the creeping night and the dangers within featuring 3-player co-op.

Take command of uniquely skilled heroes, each possessing their own abilities and distinct flair.

While individually formidable, their skills create powerful synergies when they unite as a team.

Overcome a relentless environmental threat that sweeps through a land that changes between each game session and defeat the magnificent boss of that night!"
